s.text: In hindsight, probably, we should have suspected that Judge Starr would not use the phrase "fiery loins."
Say "allies of Mr. Starr" and "lawyers familiar with Mr. Starr's plans" and so forth.

Say "allies of Mr. Starr" and "lawyers familiar with Mr. Starr's plans" and so forth.
Meanwhile, on Page A1 ("Report by Starr Against Clinton Expected Soon") of the same paper, the "possibility" of a " 'report' " from Starr was getting very different treatment.
